text: J. W. Paisley House was a historic home located at Winston-Salem, Forsyth County, North Carolina. The house was built about 1910–1911, and was a large two-story, three bay, frame dwelling. The house featured clipped gable roofs and dormers. It was built by John W. Paisley, faculty member of the Slater Industrial Academy for African-American students. The house has been demolished. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1979. ==References== Category:African-American history in Winston-Salem, North Carolina Category:Houses on the National Register of Historic Places in North Carolina Category:Houses completed in 1911 Category:Houses in Winston-Salem, North Carolina Category:National Register of Historic Places in Winston-Salem, North Carolina
title: J. W. Paisley House
